Explanation: Displays the installed Git version.
Lists all Git commands or provides help for a specific command.
Initializes a new Git repository in the current directory.
Clones a repository to your local machine.
Displays the working tree status.
Shows the commit history of the repository.
Lists all branches in the repository.
Creates a new branch.
Switches to a specific branch.
Creates and switches to a new branch.
Merges a branch into the current branch.
Deletes a branch.
Stages a file for the next commit.
Stages all changes for the next commit.
Commits staged changes with a message.
Amends the previous commit.
Unstages a file from the staging area.
Resets the repository to the last commit, discarding all changes.
Shows the remote repository URLs.
Adds a new remote repository.
Pushes changes to the remote repository.
Pushes changes to a specific branch in the remote repository.
Pulls changes from the remote repository.
Fetches updates from the remote repository without merging.
Lists all tags in the repository.
Creates a new tag.
Pushes a tag to the remote repository.
Reverts a specific commit.
Stashes current changes without committing.
Applies stashed changes.
Sets the global username for Git.
Sets the global email for Git.
Lists all Git configuration settings.
Applies changes from a specific commit onto the current branch.
Rebases the current branch onto another branch.
Displays the reference log (history of actions).
Shows who made changes to each line of a file.
Displays differences between files or commits.
Shows differences between the current branch and another branch.
Archives a branch into a zip file.
